channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WV
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WV

item.title: Report E-2023030214
item.description:
Report E-2023030214

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-21T09:09:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-17
  • City: Parkersburg
  • State: WV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX Transportation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 02/17/2023, at 1031 hours, personnel in the CSXT Parkersburg Yard discovered TILX 111211, a loaded tank car of Hydrochloric Acid, leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper of record (UNIVAR), National Response Center, West Virginia DEP, Federal Railroad Administration Field Inspector, and contracted loading entity (CHEMOURS) were notified. (CHEMTREC Report #2023-0217-00125). Enviroserve, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found approximately 35 psi of head pressure on the car detected by pressure gauge on the vapor valve. When attempting to bleed the pressure off the car, free liquid was observed coming from the vapor valve. Approximately 1 gallon of product was recovered from the vapor valve / vapor line, and the fill hole was opened. Upon accessing the fill hole product was observed inside the fill hold housing, the car identified as shell full. Specialized Professional Services, Inc was contracted by the loading entity to unload approximately 500 gallons from the car. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper Mr. Doug Nestler of UNIVAR and Ryan Goldsmith of CHEMOURS. The leak was secured and the car was released for transport. This incident did not require a special switching move. 7.1 is not required. Cause Code: 106 NARRI: 100

item.title: Report E-2023010390
item.description:
Report E-2023010390

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-20T21:08:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-18
  • City: PRINCETON
  • State: WV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 18, 2023, one (1) one-gallon jug of Sparclean Delimer 55 had a loose cap and released approximately one (1) cup of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services LC, who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to perform the necessary corrective actions. TLE personnel utilized absorbents, hand tools, and a neutralizing agent to remediate the impacted surface, then containerized all UN1760-material in one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report E-2022110098
item.description:
Report E-2022110098

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-20T21:08:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-28
  • City: CHARLESTON
  • State: WV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 10/28/2022, at 1714, personnel in the CSXT South Charleston Yard discovered GCCX 81058, a loaded Covered Hopper car of Ammonium Nitrate, leaking from the bottom of the car. The car was isolated and shipper, the National Response Center, and Chemtrec were notified. (CHEMTREC Report #2022-1028-00242). Quick Response, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found an unsecure gate door at the bottom of the chute. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper, Pete Rucks with CF Industries 847-436-6711. Contractor personnel secured the gate door, collected and containerized any released material, and decontaminated the impacted area. The leak was secured and the car was released for transport. This incident did not require a special switching move. 7.1 not required. Cause Code:662 NARRI:130

item.title: Report E-2022100374
item.description:
Report E-2022100374

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-20T21:08:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-29
  • City: Parkersburg
  • State: WV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 09/29/2022, at 1342 hours, personnel in the CSXT Parkersburg, WV Yard discovered INVX 26240 after being advised by an FRA Inspector, a loaded tank car of Hexamethylenediamine, leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, National Response Center, and West Virginia Department of Environmental Protection were notified. (CHEMTREC Report #2022-0929-00244). Quick Respone, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found a deteriorated manway nozzle gasket improperly secured resulted in the release of product at the manway nozzle. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper's representative, Mr. Thomas Moon of INV Nylon Chemicals America, phone 316-252-7642. Contractor personnel properly installed a manway nozzle gasket and secured the manway cover per 49 CFR 173.31, and cleaned all spilled material from the exterior of the car. The leak was secured and the car was released for transport. This incident did not require a special switching move. 7.1 is not required. Cause Code: 209 NARRI: 80

item.title: Report E-2022100176
item.description:
Report E-2022100176

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-20T21:08:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-26
  • City: SCOTT DEPOT
  • State: WV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Veolia employee was operating a rental forklift loading material on to a trailer. The forks of the lift were longer than usual and were protruding out on the other side of the pallet. When the employee went to place the pallet in the truck, the forks punctured a drum behind the pallet resulting in the release of about 20 gallons of material inside the trailer. No material leaked outside of the trailer.

Package was then open and it was noticed that 1 gallon container was less than half full. DescribePack: The inner container( 1 Gal) had a failure in the cap. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Once it was discovered that it did leak, the package was placed in a HAZ bag, and set inside the HAZMAT area.

item.title: Report E-2022090243
item.description:
Report E-2022090243

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-20T21:08:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-14
  • City: Parkersburg
  • State: WV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 08/14/2022, at 2330 hours, personnel in the CSXT Parkersburg Yard discovered SCMX 4038, a loaded tank car of Isoprene, leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and shipper of record, National Response Center, and West Virginia DEP were notified. (CHEMTREC Report #2022-0815-00003). Specialized Professional Services, Inc, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the vapor line operating handle partially open and the secondary closure plug less than tool tight. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper, Mr. Ron Riddell of Goodyear Tire & Rubber, phone 330.604.3676. Contractor personnel closed the vapor valve operating handle and installed the secondary closure plug in accordance with 49 CFR 173.31. The leak was secured and the car was released for transport. This incident did not require a special switching move. 7.1 is not required. Cause Code: 136 NARRI: 100

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: On 08/07/2022, at 1731 hours, personnel in the CSXT Parkersburg Yard discovered UTLX 952520, a loaded tank car of Isoprene, leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper of record, National Response Center, and West Virginia DEP were notified. (CHEMTREC Report #2022-0807-00047). Specialized Professional Services, Inc, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the vapor valve operating handle partially open and the secondary closure plug less than tool tight. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper Mr. Pat Mentzel of Odjfell Terminals, phone 832-359-1557. Contractor personnel closed the operating valve and installed the secondary closure plug in accordance with 49 CFR 173.31. The leak was secured and the car was released for transport. This incident did not require a special switching move. 7.1 is not required. Cause Code: 136 NARRI:100

item.title: Report E-2022081270
item.description:
Report E-2022081270

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-20T21:08:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-03
  • City: MARTINSBURG
  • State: WV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 03, 2022, Landstar called to request assistance for a 5-gallon release of Sodium hydroxide, solution cleaning products by Ecolab impacting the inside of trailer 755440 and underneath the trailer. Before the contractor arrived the driver placed a piece of cardboard underneath the trailer to contain the release. Hepaco arrived on site and placed oil dri down to further contain the release while unloading the trailer to locate the damaged drums. After further inspection the contractor found an additional product that was released, Reliance Liquid pot & pan detergent, non- regulated item, a total of three 5-gallon buckets were damaged due to what the contractor presumed was caused by weight/pressure from a load shift because the leakage was observed from the seal of the associated lid and no puncture or cracks were observed. Only media affected consisted of the trailer components and underlying asphalt, no soil or waterways were impacted. Waste is currently pending disposal.

item.title: Report E-2022081105
item.description:
Report E-2022081105

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-20T21:08:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-01
  • City: PARKERSBURG
  • State: WV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 07/01/2022, at 1126 hours, personnel in the CSXT Parkersburg, WV Yard discovered INVX 26191, a loaded tank car of Hexamethylenediamine, leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, National Response Center, and West Virginia DEP were notified. (CHEMTREC Report #2022-0701-00331). Specialized Professional Services, Inc., a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found a significantly deteriorated manway nozzle gasket that resulted in the release of lading. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper Thomas Moon of INV Nylon Chemicals, phone 316-252-7642. Contractor personnel removed the defective gasket and replaced in kind and secure the manway per 49 CFR 173.31, and cleaned all spilled material. The leak was secured and the car was released for transport. This incident did not require a special switching move. 7.1 is not required. Cause Code: 209 NARRI: 80

item.title: Report E-2022080842
item.description:
Report E-2022080842

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 19, 2022, Following a tractor-trailer roll-over incident, ERTS received a request to dispatch a remediation contractor to address a potential release of UN 1993 product from up to nine (9) steel totes. Following contractor arrival and assessment, it was concluded that approximately 750 gallons of product spilled, of which, approximately 350 gallons of product is estimated to have spilled outside the trailer, affecting underlying asphalt. The totes were subsequently removed from the trailer and relocated to nearby Clean Harbors, Poca, WV staging facility per the coordination of Celanese. Affected trailer components were properly addressed and disposal is pending. The affected asphalt was subsequently milled and then replaced/repaired by DOT. Waste is still pending disposal.

item.title: Report E-2022070476
item.description:
Report E-2022070476

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-20T21:08:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-08
  • City: SCOTT DEPOT
  • State: WV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 7/8/2022 Veolia employees from the West Virginia office picked up a load of containers from a customers site. The majority of the shipment was 55 gallon drums of flammable paint. The drums were loaded 4 to a pallet and were then loaded onto Veolia's truck with no issue. Upon return to Veolia's West Virginia officer the Veolia driver attempted to offload the box truck using a seated forklift. As he was driving over the dock plate that leads into the warehouse one of the drums that was loaded on the pallet he was carrying tilted forward and fell off the pallet. The drum fell to the floor of the truck and the lid popped up when it hit the ground leading to the release of white paint. The paint was contained inside the truck using spill dry and absorbent pads. Following the incident Veolia employees inspected both the pallet and the 55 gallon drum. It was discovered that the pallet was missing several boards which made it unstable. When then employee drove over the dock plate the bump and incline allowed the drum to tip into the gap left from the broken pallet and fall forward to the ground. When the drum hit the ground the lid folded up allowing the liquid to leak from the container. The time of the release was less than a minute. Our employee was able to quickly pick up the container to prevent further leakage after the event occurred. All spill debris was properly cleaned up and placed inside a spill clean up drum for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2022070659
item.description:
Report E-2022070659

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-20T21:08:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-06-16
  • City: BELLE
  • State: WV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 16, 2022, XPO notified ERTS of a UN3265 "Nalcon 7678 Paper Mill Slimicide" release due to improper loading. Hepaco arrived on-site and confirmed approximately 25-gallons of product released affecting an 8’ xby 20’ area of the trailer floor. The contractors transferred all salvageable product into (2) 275-gallon poly totes to be shipped on and collected and containerized all clean-up debris into (1) 55-gallos poly drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2022070107
item.description:
Report E-2022070107

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-20T21:08:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-06-06
  • City: PARKERSBURG
  • State: WV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRASNPORTATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 06/06/2022, at 1444 hours, FRA MP&E Inspector observed in the CSXT Parkersburg Yard AXLX 3154, a loaded tank car of Sodium Hydroxide Solution, leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, National Response Center, and West Virginia Department of Environmental Protection were notified. (CHEMTREC Report #2022-0606-00271). Specialized Professional Services, Incorporated, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found a displaced and torn manway nozzle gasket resulting in a Non-Accident Release of Hazardous Materials. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper's representative, Mr. Matthew Bond of Axiall Corporation, phone 304-266-8287. Contractor personnel removed the defective gasket, installed an in-kind new replacement, and cleaned all spill material from the exterior of the car. The leak was secured and the car was released for transport. This incident did not require a special switching move. 7.1 is not required. Cause Code: 208 NARRI: 100

item.title: Report E-2022060170
item.description:
Report E-2022060170

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-20T21:08:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-05-13
  • City: WILLIAMSTOWN
  • State: WV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0904 ET, XPO terminal XPK reported a release of 3-4 liters of STEAMATE PAS8040 from a 237-liter tote due to unknown causes in Williamstown, WV. The release was contained to the trailer and did not affect any storm drains or waterways. ERTS dispatched Zema Brothers to conduct cleanup. At 1741 ET, crew arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1.5 gallons of product released to a 4' x 4' area of the trailer floor. Crew advised the Camlock cap popped off as a result of built up pressure inside the tote. After inspection, the tote was found to not be leaking, however once the cap popped off, neighboring freight was impacted. 42 boxes of food grade "Nestle Boost" were impacted and drummed up as waste. The boxes were placed into an 85 gallon metal, 55 gallon poly, and a 35 gallon poly drums. Absorbents were worked into the impacted trailer floor as well which was placed into a 20 gallon and 10 gallon metal drums. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
